rComments: I took this class last year. Was recommended not to by a friend who took it previously but was interested in the subject. The instructor is aloof, condescending, and arrogant. Maybe a result of employee withdrawal but it's no excuse. He comes to lecture late. He previously skipped a lecture entirely because he was running late.
Okayish. Gets boring sometimes. No breaks.

Amazing. We always parked close to eachother so at the end of every class we would walk to our cars and talk about about the lecture. I learned so much from him and I wish it wasnt in my last year or I would have taken every class he teaches. So enthusiastic and knowledgeable! One of my favorites

Realistically, this course should be called American Media-politics. All the prof does is talk about the course textbook verbatim. The textbook is 95% of this course. Lectures are interesting given his eccentric behaviour, and are mandatory for success, considering what he talks about (again from textbook) will be on the tests. Very tough grader.
Very entertaining classes but does not seem very approachable at first. He gets better with time.
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'Amazing lectures', 'Gives good feedback']

rComments: Amazing professor. Learnt a lot. Go to class.
teacherRatingTags: ["Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Participation matters', 'Tough grader']

rComments: Very entertaining in class. If you dont go to class you wont do well. Also very helpful during office hours if you have any questions.

Amazing Prof. This was the best POL course I took in university. Really gets you thinking and he makes it interesting by bringing in a lot of current and relevant topics. An entire portion of this class involved understanding pop culture. Really neat stuff!

This is a very enthusiastic prof who is really passionate about politics. You never want to miss any of his classes because he is so entertaining with the material. The essays are not the easiest because he is very vague. He expects you to steer it in a direction that you think will be effective. Overall, a interesting class that you learn a lot.

If you are looking for a bird course this may not be the professor for you. He is engaging and knowledgeable but you definitely need put in an effort when striving for an 80 or above. Lectures are easy to follow, test are fair, readings are not crucial. The essay is where most will have difficulty, suggest going to his office hours for more clarity

Great + unusualinnovative professor. Funny & down to earth. Can be a little more erratic than your typical instructor, but also much easier to speak with than other instructors. Lectures  crucial; readings not as much. Tests relatively easy if you've shown up to class. Expectations on assignments clear; follow them stringently and you'll do well.

Wootten is an excellent professor. He is very knowledgeable and passionate about what he teaches. Be prepared to go to lectures, they are crucial in successfully completing the course.  Excellent lecturer; he leaves room for questions, engagement and shared opinions. I could only assume the negative comments come from those who didn't work hard.

Wootten is an example of a bad professor. Wootten, cannot organize a coherent syllabus. He does not concentrate fully in his lecturing and is always distracted. He takes minimal interest in lecturing and instead wants the class to lecture itself. Wootten tends to be silly and and frequently needs to sit when lecturing. He needs supervision asap.

Awesome prof who really knows his stuff! Very interesting lecture sessions and topics. The two papers were graded fairly with a good amount of feedback, the course journal was an excellent alternative to participation and the final was very fair (know readings for shirt answers and attend lectures for essay questions) - great class and prof!!
Very engaging, lectures are very interesting. Need to know the articles for mid-term and final exam. Very easy going.
LOVE!!! very clear, very smart, smart funny. distributes assignments/tests marks well
est prof I've had.. makes the class very fun. some dont like him because he isnt as conservative as they want a prof to be. but his teaching is one of the best i've experienced at utm
amazing prof. very smart and has great communication. he makes the class fun so you actually want to go. you NEED to do to the readings to pass the class

Very insightful prof. However, DO NOT take POL369 in the summer if you want a laid-back class where you can rely on powerpoints to get by (he has none). You must do the readings and you have quizzes and a reaction cards every week so you must go to every class. There is also a participation mark.

Excellent Prof, has a vast amount of knowledge he disperses once he gets in the zone. Has spent hours with me discussing topics in his office. Some may find him too laid back, but his essay grading is much more serious and challenges students to produce quality essays through multiple evaluations and submissions.

Very good professor. I was not very interested in the subject matter of politics and media, or his other course for that matter. But after having taken one, I took the other right away. I ended up learning alot about public policy and framing techniques used by politicians. The course was educational and alot of fun.

He is very immature. Classes should not be cancelled because he is "too hot" or because he feels "too sweaty".  Also, he sometimes did not even show up, and we made the trek all the way to school for the class.  He seemed to not really take it seriously, but he marks as though he has really taught something.
Very easy going, easy class, nice, understanding educated down to earth prof.
No Comments
